legacyPatterns.modernizationPath: Replace with Azure Service Bus, RabbitMQ, or in-process background services

legacyPatterns.modernizationPath: Use distributed cache (Redis) or database-backed cart

securityConcerns: MSMQ security configuration should be reviewed
No input validation visible in controllers

migrationPath.strategy: Incremental migration with parallel run capability

phases.name: Infrastructure Setup
tasks: Create new .NET 8.0 solution structure
Set up dependency injection container
Configure logging and configuration system
Set up Entity Framework Core with database

phases.name: Data Layer Migration
tasks: Design database schema for products and categories
Implement Entity Framework Core models and DbContext
Seed initial product data
Create repository pattern or use EF Core directly

phases.name: Service Layer Migration
tasks: Replace WCF service with ASP.NET Core Web API
Implement RESTful endpoints for product operations
Add API versioning and documentation (Swagger)
Implement proper error handling and validation

phases.name: Web Application Migration
tasks: Create ASP.NET Core MVC project
Migrate views to Razor Pages or MVC views
Implement HTTP client for API calls instead of WCF
Migrate session-based cart to distributed cache or database
Update bundling and minification approach

phases.name: Message Queue Migration
tasks: Replace MSMQ with modern message queue (Azure Service Bus/RabbitMQ) or background service
Migrate OrderQueueService to new messaging infrastructure
Update OrderProcessor to Worker Service pattern
Implement proper retry and error handling

immediate: Add unit and integration tests before migration
Document current business logic and workflows
Set up version control branching strategy for migration
Create development/staging environment for new stack
shortTerm: Start with data layer migration to establish foundation
Migrate WCF to Web API for better interoperability
longTerm: Implement CI/CD pipeline for automated deployments
Consider moving to cloud-native message queue (Azure Service Bus)

technical.risk: WCF to REST API migration may require client contract changes
technical.mitigation: Create API compatibility layer or versioning strategy
Plan thorough testing of message delivery and processing

technical.risk: Session state migration may affect user experience
technical.mitigation: Implement proper cart persistence and recovery

technical.risk: In-memory data will be lost on migration
technical.mitigation: Seed data into new database during migration

business.mitigation: Use blue-green deployment or parallel run strategy
Maintain feature checklist and thorough testing

technical: Modern dependency injection and middleware pipeline
Built-in support for modern development practices
Active long-term support and security updates
business: Reduced hosting costs with Linux deployment options
Easier cloud deployment (Azure, AWS, Google Cloud)
Improved application performance and user experience
